conversations.content: Bob shared some discounts via email. Please check the SSD I bought today and see if Bob's discount would have been cheaper. If so, refund my purchase and rebuy it using his discount.

<function_thought>
The user wants to check if a discount from Bob would have been cheaper for an SSD purchased today.
If so, I need to refund the purchase and rebuy it with the better discount.

First, I need to find the email from Bob with the discounts. I will use `get_shopping_linked_received_emails` to get all received emails and then look for an email from Bob.
Second, I need to find the SSD purchased today. I will use `view_order_history` to get the user's order history and look for an order made today for an SSD.
Third, I will get the invoice for that order to see the price paid.
Fourth, I will compare the price with the discount from Bob.
If the discount from Bob is better, I will refund the order and rebuy the SSD with the new discount.

Let's start by getting the received emails.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_shopping_linked_received_emails()]</function_call>
